p.s: POOP

If you like challenge in your first person shooters, you'll definitely find it here. The hit detection is specially designed to make some of your shots miss if you just spam shots. This is probably one of the most challenging multiplayer shooter games of all time.

That aside, the gameplay itself is smooth and enjoyable. You usually either go all sneak, or all rush. Either way, you absolutely must have good reflexes to get anywhere on the scoreboard. All guns have a great balance to them, and it's good, like any other well-balanced game, to find which one suits your style. Like I mentioned before, it's not a good idea to spam with most of the guns. However, if you get a weapon like the P90 or the MP5 this isn't as true.

The graphics, considering the game's age, are excellent. Sharp textures and realistic shading weren't really a thing back then (and honestly still aren't now, but I digress) but the game definitely holds its own against other games from the time.

The sound quality is on the low end, but this is merely in homage to the original version of the game/mod, back in the late 90's. That said, it doesn't take much from the experience and adds a bonus nolstagia to players of the original game.

Like many older multiplayer shooters, there isn't much in terms of progression. If you like, for example, the ranking system from CoD or BF, you won't find anything of that sort here. It definitely is a possible negative for some.

Last but not least, this game still has a large community to this day. There are many, many custom maps, mods, etc. I personally stick with the base game most of the time, but if you get bored, you can escape to them. Anyways, the community consists mostly of players in their late teens and older. You won't find many children in this game. Beware, however. If you are a child yourself (under the age of 16 atleast) you may find many grumpy people who won't like you and especially your voice. You have been warned.

Overall, this is a wonderful game. I play it on and off, but I have no doubt that is indeed a classic.
